Package se.arkalix.net.http.service

Interface HttpServiceResponse

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HttpBodySender<HttpServiceResponse>
    public interface HttpServiceResponse
extends HttpBodySender<HttpServiceResponse>
    An outgoing HTTP response, to be sent by an HttpServiceInternal.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • body

        HttpServiceResponse body​(DtoWritable data)
        Sets outgoing HTTP body, replacing any previously set such.

        The provided writable data transfer object is scheduled for encoding, using the encoding chosen automatically for this response, and transmission to the receiver of the body. Please refer to the Javadoc for the @Writable annotation for more information about writable data transfer objects.

        Parameters:
        data - Data transfer object to send to receiver of the body.
        Returns:
        This.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If encoding or body is null.
        See Also:
        @Writable

      • clearHeaders

        HttpServiceResponse clearHeaders()
        Removes all currently set headers.
        Returns:
        This response object.

      • header

        default java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> header​(java.lang.CharSequence name)
        Gets a response header value by name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of header. Case insensitive. Should be lower-case.
        Returns:
        Header value, if any.

      • header

        default HttpServiceResponse header​(java.lang.CharSequence name,
                                   java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Sets a response header.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of header. Case insensitive. Should be lower-case.
        value - Header value.
        Returns:
        This response object.

      • headers

        HttpHeaders headers()
        Returns:
        Modifiable response headers.

      • status

        java.util.Optional<HttpStatus> status()
        Returns:
        Currently set response HttpStatus, if any.

      • status

        HttpServiceResponse status​(HttpStatus status)
        Sets response status.

        If a response status is explicitly set by a HttpValidatorHandler, the associated request will not be passed on to any further validator handlers or a route handler.

        Parameters:
        status - New response HttpStatus.
        Returns:
        This response object.

      • version

        HttpVersion version()
        Returns:
        Designated response HttpVersion.
